hybridmediaplayer

Class CastPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • hybridmediaplayer.CastPlayer

  • public final class CastPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Player implementation that communicates with a Cast receiver app.

    The behavior of this class depends on the underlying Cast session, which is obtained from the Cast context passed to CastPlayer(CastContext). To keep track of the session, isCastSessionAvailable() can be queried and CastPlayer.SessionAvailabilityListener can be implemented and attached to the player.

    If no session is available, the player state will remain unchanged and calls to methods that alter it will be ignored. Querying the player state is possible even when no session is available, in which case, the last observed receiver app state is reported.

    Methods should be called on the application's main thread.

    • Method Detail

      • loadItem

        public <any> loadItem(MediaQueueItem item,
                      long positionMs)
        Loads a single item media queue. If no session is available, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to load.
        positionMs - The position at which the playback should start in milliseconds relative to the start of the item at startIndex. If C#TIME_UNSET is passed, playback starts at position 0.
        Returns:
        The Cast PendingResult, or null if no session is available.

      • loadItems

        public <any> loadItems(MediaQueueItem[] items,
                       int startIndex,
                       long positionMs,
                       int repeatMode)
        Loads a media queue. If no session is available, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        items - The items to load.
        startIndex - The index of the item at which playback should start.
        positionMs - The position at which the playback should start in milliseconds relative to the start of the item at startIndex. If C#TIME_UNSET is passed, playback starts at position 0.
        repeatMode - The repeat mode for the created media queue.
        Returns:
        The Cast PendingResult, or null if no session is available.

      • addItems

        public <any> addItems(MediaQueueItem... items)
        Appends a sequence of items to the media queue. If no media queue exists, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        items - The items to append.
        Returns:
        The Cast PendingResult, or null if no media queue exists.

      • addItems

        public <any> addItems(int periodId,
                      MediaQueueItem... items)
        Inserts a sequence of items into the media queue. If no media queue or period with id periodId exist, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        periodId - The id of the period (getCurrentTimeline()) that corresponds to the item that will follow immediately after the inserted items.
        items - The items to insert.
        Returns:
        The Cast PendingResult, or null if no media queue or no period with id periodId exist.

      • removeItem

        public <any> removeItem(int periodId)
        Removes an item from the media queue. If no media queue or period with id periodId exist, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        periodId - The id of the period (getCurrentTimeline()) that corresponds to the item to remove.
        Returns:
        The Cast PendingResult, or null if no media queue or no period with id periodId exist.

      • moveItem

        public <any> moveItem(int periodId,
                      int newIndex)
        Moves an existing item within the media queue. If no media queue or period with id periodId exist, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        periodId - The id of the period (getCurrentTimeline()) that corresponds to the item to move.
        newIndex - The target index of the item in the media queue. Must be in the range 0 <= index < Timeline#getPeriodCount(), as provided by getCurrentTimeline().
        Returns:
        The Cast PendingResult, or null if no media queue or no period with id periodId exist.

      • getItem

        public MediaQueueItem getItem(int periodId)
        Returns the item that corresponds to the period with the given id, or null if no media queue or period with id periodId exist.
        Parameters:
        periodId - The id of the period (getCurrentTimeline()) that corresponds to the item to get.
        Returns:
        The item that corresponds to the period with the given id, or null if no media queue or period with id periodId exist.
